title: Top 5 Tips for Preparing Your First Marathon
author: Md. Maidul Islam
excerpt: Marathon for beginners can seem daunting. Here are five simple tips to train smarter and finish strong.
content:
1. Start early – Begin training at least 8–12 weeks ahead.
2. Follow a training plan – Stick to a beginner-friendly schedule.
3. Hydration & nutrition – Drink water regularly and maintain a balanced diet.
4. Get proper gear – Use a good pair of running shoes and breathable clothes.
5. Rest is key – Don’t ignore rest days; recovery will help you run better on race day.

Prepare patiently and enjoy every step of your marathon journey!

title: Nutrition For Runners: What To Eat Before And After
author: Run Expert
excerpt: Fueling your body the right way helps improve performance and recovery. Let’s dive into what matters most.
content:
Before a run: Eat complex carbs like oatmeal, banana, or whole-grain toast 1.5–2 hours before.
During: For longer races, energy gels or a sports drink every 45–60 minutes.
After: Focus on protein-rich meals with good carbs – e.g., a chicken sandwich or Greek yogurt + fruit.

Pace your meals with your runs and avoid running immediately after eating to avoid cramps.

title: Must-Have Gear for Every Marathon Runner
author: Sports Weekly
excerpt: From shoes to hydration belts, here’s what you need in your gear list before hitting the marathon track.
content:
Essential gear includes:
- Running Shoes: Choose ones that suit your gait.
- Moisture-Wicking Clothing: Keeps you dry and comfortable.
- Hydration Belt or Vest: Carry water or electrolytes for long runs.
- GPS Smartwatch: Track your distance and pace.
- Anti-Chafing Cream: Prevents skin irritation.

Make a checklist before every event to avoid missing key items.
